channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Water shortage warning in Northern Ireland as demand outstrips supply
item.description: NI Water tankers are moving water 24 hours a day to keep reservoirs topped up.

item.title: Covid-19: No EU vaccine certificate for Irish passport holders in NI
item.description: The EU Digital Covid Certificate will come into effect in the Republic of Ireland on Monday.

item.title: Covid-19: Ireland's top medical officers targeted by abusive calls
item.description: Gardaí are investigating reports of abusive calls to Ireland's chief medical officer and his deputy.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records another death, 537 new cases
item.description: The number of new positive tests is down from 1,402 on Saturday, health department figures show.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Rory McIlroy says he is 'not very patriotic' and playing Games is 'the right thing to do'
item.description: Rory McIlroy questions whether there is much to look forward to for him at the Olympic Games after finishing on level par at The Open.

item.title: Ann Murray, the illegal poteen distiller who lived in a cave
item.description: Ann Murray spent 50 years living and producing her own alcohol in County Antrim's Red Bay Caves.

item.title: Injured man found on side of road in County Armagh
item.description: Police say the man, believed to be in his 40s, was discovered on the Cortynan Road near Tynan.

item.title: North Belfast: Boy punched in sectarian assault
item.description: Police say they are treating an attack on a 12-year-old boy as a sectarian hate crime.

item.title: Ulster SFC: Tyrone into final after 0-23 to 1-14 win over 14-man Donegal
item.description: Tyrone will meet Monaghan in the Ulster final on 1 August after beating 14-man Donegal 0-23 to 1-14 in Enniskillen

item.title: Mary Ann McCracken letters shed new light on last years
item.description: The anti-slavery campaigner was active in Belfast well into her 90s, new letters reveal.

item.title: Brexit: Supermarkets warn of rising costs due to NI Protocol
item.description: Supermarket chains say retailers may be forced to switch from British suppliers to EU suppliers.

item.title: East Belfast: Man arrested after assault using weapons
item.description: A 53-year-old man is in hospital after sustaining serious injuries during the incident in east Belfast.

item.title: Walk-in vaccine clinics open across NI
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a Covid-19 at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern Trust suspends hospital visits as cases spike
item.description: The decision was taken as NI recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus cases since January.

item.title: Interim Covid vaccine certificates to be launched for NI travellers
item.description: Anyone travelling from Northern Ireland after the 25 July should wait to use a new app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitality Ulster calls for NI recovery strategy
item.description: Industry representatives say businesses are struggling after lockdown and need help from Stormont.

item.title: Coronavirus: Robin Swann concerned by rise in Covid-19 cases
item.description: More than 1,000 new cases of Covid-19 were recorded in Northern Ireland on Thursday.

item.title: Hottest NI day ever as temperatures soar above 30C
item.description: Ballywatticock near Newtownards records 31.2C on Saturday, breaking a record set 45 years ago.

item.title: Egyptian vulture spotted in Ireland for the first time
item.description: The endangered Egyptian vulture paid a flying visit to the village of Dunfanaghy in County Donegal.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Eleventh Night: What is the law on bonfires in Northern Ireland?
item.description: Some politicians are calling for new regulations, while others want existing rules enforced.

item.title: 'Our semi-final victory is for Brendan Og'
item.description: Monaghan captain Ryan Wylie says the Ulster semi-final win over Armagh was for Brendan Og Duffy, the U20 captain who died in a car accident on Friday night.

item.title: Child meets police officer who donated kidney to him
item.description: Nine-year-old Joshua and police officer Graham Dodds recall a life-changing kidney transplant.

item.title: Covid-19: Vance McElhinney meets daughter for first time
item.description: Vance McElhinney's partner and baby daughter flew from Vietnam to NI to reunite after the pandemic.

item.title: Paul Givan: 'This is a further insult to victims'
item.description: The government intends to bring forward legislation to ban all Troubles-related prosecutions.

item.title: Derry win All-Ireland Minor Football Championship
item.description: Derry leave it late to beat Kerry by 2-12 to 1-14 and win a first All-Ireland Minor final in 19 years at Tullamore.

item.title: Colum Eastwood: MP reveals death threats after naming Soldier F
item.description: Colum Eastwood named the former paratrooper, accused of two Bloody Sunday murders, in Parliament.

item.title: Final submissions in Lu Na McKinney case
item.description: Stephen McKinney, 44, denies murdering his wife during a boat trip in County Fermanagh, in 2017.

item.title: Man in court charged with murdering partner
item.description: Thomas Davidson, 53, is accused of murdering his partner Kathleen Brankin near Limavady.

item.title: Brendan Óg Duffy: Monaghan GAA U20s captain dies in car crash
item.description: Brendan Óg Duffy lost his life just hours after captaining the Monaghan team to a semi-final win.

item.title: Brexit: UK urged to match 'generosity of spirit' over protocol
item.description: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen says the protocol is "the only solution".

item.title: Inhaler: Bono's son and his band top UK chart with debut album
item.description: Elijah Hewson's rock group knock Olivia Rodrigo off the top spot with their debut album.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish senate passes indoor hospitality legislation
item.description: Fully vaccinated people and those who have recovered from Covid-19 will be able to eat and drink indoors.

item.title: Champions League: Istanbul to host 2023 Champions League final after 2021 switch
item.description: Istanbul is to host the 2023 Champions League final while Dublin will stage the following year's Europa League final.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish government passes indoor hospitality legislation
item.description: New legislation will allow people fully vaccinated against Covid-19 to eat and drink in indoor venues.
